intro: Echinospermum pilosum, commonly known as the hairy echinosperm, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers with prominent central disk flowers. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated for its distinctive appearance.
